revised_title: Intraspinal Tracts and Long Spinal Reflexes in Mammalian Cord
tldr: The authors investigate descending intrinsic spinal tracts in the mammalian cord and discover two categories of fibers: long spinal fibers that pass beyond the limits of the spinal region they arise in and short spinal fibers that do not. They also find that long spinal fibers do not decussate, confirming Munzer's findings.
